DataElement.preferredName: Surgical Patient Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Low Grade Glioma To Malignant Glioma Likely Disease Progression Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Indicator of whether surgical patient's low-grade glioma is likely to progress to malignant glioma.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Surgical Patient Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Low Grade Glioma To Malignant Glioma Likely Disease Progression
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery._A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria._A grade I or grade II glioma arising from the central nervous system. This category includes pilocytic astrocytoma, diffuse astrocytoma, subependymal giant cell astrocytoma, ependymoma, oligodendroglioma, oligoastrocytoma, and angiocentric glioma._Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement._A malignant neuroglial neoplasm. The term can apply to several primary neoplasm of the brain and spinal cord, including astrocytoma and oligodendroglioma in addition to others._Having a good chance of being the case or of coming about._The worsening of a disease over time.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Surgical Patient Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.:A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.
A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Property.preferredName: Low Grade Glioma To Malignant Glioma Likely Disease Progression
Property.preferredDefinition: A grade I or grade II glioma arising from the central nervous system. This category includes pilocytic astrocytoma, diffuse astrocytoma, subependymal giant cell astrocytoma, ependymoma, oligodendroglioma, oligoastrocytoma, and angiocentric glioma.:Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.:A malignant neuroglial neoplasm. The term can apply to several primary neoplasm of the brain and spinal cord, including astrocytoma and oligodendroglioma in addition to others.:Having a good chance of being the case or of coming about.:The worsening of a disease over time.

Concepts.definition: A grade I or grade II glioma arising from the central nervous system. This category includes pilocytic astrocytoma, diffuse astrocytoma, subependymal giant cell astrocytoma, ependymoma, oligodendroglioma, oligoastrocytoma, and angiocentric glioma.
Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.

A grade 3 or grade 4 glioma arising from the central nervous system. This category includes glioblastoma, anaplastic astrocytoma, anaplastic ependymoma, anaplastic oligodendroglioma, and anaplastic oligoastrocytoma.
Having a good chance of being the case or of coming about.
A process that manifests as the worsening of a disease over time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ReferenceDocuments.name: For surgical patient, if pati
ReferenceDocuments.description: For surgical patient, if patient has a BRAF-V600 E or K mutated low grade glioma, is there a strong suspicion for progression to high grade?
